question_text:
If ‘→’ denotes increasing order of intensity, then the meaning of the words
[dry → arid → parched] is analogous to [diet → fast → __________].
Which one of the given options is appropriate to fill the blank?
subject: General Aptitude

question_text: If two distinct non-zero real variables x and y are such that (x + y) is proportional to (x − y) then the value of x/y
options: depends only on x and not on y
depends only on y and not on x
subject: General Aptitude

question_text:
Consider the following sample of numbers:
9, 18, 11, 14, 15, 17, 10, 69, 11, 13
The median of the sample is
subject: Engineering Mathematics
subtopic: Mean, median, mode and standard deviation

question_text: The number of coins of ₹1, ₹5, and ₹10 denominations that a person has are in the ratio 5:3:13. Of the total amount, the percentage of money in ₹5 coins is
subject: General Aptitude

question_text:
For positive non-zero real variables p and q, if
log (p² + q²) = log p + log q + 2 log 3,
then, the value of (p⁴+q⁴)/(p²q²) is
subject: General Aptitude

question_text:
In the given text, the blanks are numbered (i)–(iv). Select the best match for all the blanks.
Steve was advised to keep his head __(i)__ before heading __(ii)__ to bat; for, while he had a head __(iii)__ batting, he could only do so with a cool head __(iv)__ his shoulders.
subject: General Aptitude

question_text:
A rectangular paper sheet of dimensions 54 cm × 4 cm is taken. The two longer edges of the sheet are joined together to create a cylindrical tube. A cube whose surface area is equal to the area of the sheet is also taken.
Then, the ratio of the volume of the cylindrical tube to the volume of the cube is
subject: General Aptitude

question_text: The pie chart presents the percentage contribution of different macronutrients to a typical 2,000 kcal diet of a person. The typical energy density (kcal/g) of these macronutrients is given in the table. The total fat (all three types), in grams, this person consumes is
subject: General Aptitude

question_text: A rectangular paper of 20 cm × 8 cm is folded 3 times. Each fold is made along the line of symmetry, which is perpendicular to its long edge. The perimeter of the final folded sheet (in cm) is
subject: General Aptitude

question_text: The least number of squares to be added in the figure to make AB a line of symmetry is
subject: General Aptitude

question_text: Let f : ℝ → ℝ be a function such that f(x) = max{x, x³}, x ∈ ℝ, where ℝ is the set of all real numbers. The set of all points where f(x) is NOT differentiable is
subject: Engineering Mathematics

question_text: The product of all eigenvalues of the matrix [[1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6], [7, 8, 9]] is
subject: Engineering Mathematics

question_text: Consider a system that uses 5 bits for representing signed integers in 2’s complement format. In this system, two integers A and B are represented as A=01010 and B=11010. Which one of the following operations will result in either an arithmetic overflow or an arithmetic underflow?
subject: Digital Logic
subtopic: Number representations and computer arithmetic (fixed and floating point)

question_text: Consider a permutation sampled uniformly at random from the set of all permutations of {1, 2, 3, . . . , n} for some n ≥ 4. Let X be the event that 1 occurs before 2 in the permutation, and Y the event that 3 occurs before 4. Which one of the following statements is TRUE?
options: The events X and Y are mutually exclusive
The events X and Y are independent
Either event X or Y must occur
Event X is more likely than event Y
subject: Engineering Mathematics

question_text: Which one of the following statements is FALSE?
options: In the cycle stealing mode of DMA, one word of data is transferred between an I/O device and main memory in a stolen cycle
For bulk data transfer, the burst mode of DMA has a higher throughput than the cycle stealing mode
Programmed I/O mechanism has a better CPU utilization than the interrupt driven I/O mechanism
The CPU can start executing an interrupt service routine faster with vectored interrupts than with non-vectored interrupts
subject: Computer Organization and Architecture

question_text:
A user starts browsing a webpage hosted at a remote server. The browser opens a single TCP connection to fetch the entire webpage from the server. The webpage consists of a top-level index page with multiple embedded image objects. Assume that all caches (e.g., DNS cache, browser cache) are all initially empty. The following packets leave the user’s computer in some order.
(i) HTTP GET request for the index page
(ii) DNS request to resolve the web server’s name to its IP address
(iii) HTTP GET request for an image object
(iv) TCP SYN to open a connection to the web server
Which one of the following is the CORRECT chronological order (earliest in time to latest) of the packets leaving the computer ?
subject: Computer Networks
subtopic: Application layer protocols: DNS, SMTP, HTTP, FTP, Email

question_text: Given an integer array of size N, we want to check if the array is sorted (in either ascending or descending order). An algorithm solves this problem by making a single pass through the array and comparing each element of the array only with its adjacent elements. The worst-case time complexity of this algorithm is
subject: Algorithms
subtopic: Asymptotic worst case time and space complexity

options: The program gets stuck in an infinite loop
subject: Programming and Data Structures

options: The program will terminate with no output
The program will terminate with 4321 as output
The program will terminate with 1234 as output
subject: Programming and Data Structures

question_text: Let S be the specification: “Instructors teach courses. Students register for courses. Courses are allocated classrooms. Instructors guide students.” Which one of the following ER diagrams CORRECTLY represents S?
subject: Databases

question_text: In a B+ tree, the requirement of at least half-full (50%) node occupancy is relaxed for which one of the following cases?
subject: Databases
subtopic: File organization, indexing (e.g., B and B+ trees)

question_text: Which of the following statements about a relation R in first normal form (1NF) is/are TRUE ?
options: R can have a multi-attribute key
R cannot have a foreign key
R cannot have a composite attribute
R cannot have more than one candidate key
subject: Databases

question_text: Let L₁, L₂ be two regular languages and L₃ a language which is not regular. Which of the following statements is/are always TRUE?
options: L₁ = L₂ if and only if L₁ ∩ L₂ᶜ = φ
subject: Theory of Computation
subtopic: Regular and context-free languages, pumping lemma

question_text: Which of the following statements about threads is/are TRUE?
options: Threads can only be implemented in kernel space
Each thread has its own file descriptor table for open files
All the threads belonging to a process share a common stack
Threads belonging to a process are by default not protected from each other
subject: Operating System
subtopic: System calls, processes, threads, inter-process communication, concurrency and synchronization

question_text: Which of the following process state transitions is/are NOT possible?
subject: Operating System
subtopic: System calls, processes, threads, inter-process communication, concurrency and synchronization

question_text: Which of the following is/are Bottom-Up Parser(s)?
subject: Compiler Design

question_text: Let A and B be two events in a probability space with P(A) = 0.3, P(B) = 0.5, and P(A ∩ B) = 0.1. Which of the following statements is/are TRUE?
options: The two events A and B are independent
P(A ∩ Bᶜ) = 0.2, where Bᶜ is the complement of the event B
P(Aᶜ ∩ Bᶜ) = 0.4, where Aᶜ and Bᶜ are the complements of the events A and B, respectively
subject: Engineering Mathematics

question_text: Consider the circuit shown below where the gates may have propagation delays. Assume that all signal transitions occur instantaneously and that wires have no delays. Which of the following statements about the circuit is/are CORRECT?
options: With no propagation delays, the output Y is always logic Zero
With no propagation delays, the output Y is always logic One
With propagation delays, the output Y can have a transient logic One after X transitions from logic Zero to logic One
With propagation delays, the output Y can have a transient logic Zero after X transitions from logic One to logic Zero
subject: Digital Logic

question_text: TCP client P successfully establishes a connection to TCP server Q. Let Nₚ denote the sequence number in the SYN sent from P to Q. Let Nₐ denote the acknowledgement number in the SYN ACK from Q to P. Which of the following statements is/are CORRECT?
options: The sequence number Nₚ is chosen randomly by P
The sequence number Nₚ is always 0 for a new connection
The acknowledgement number Nₐ is equal to Nₚ
The acknowledgement number Nₐ is equal to Nₚ + 1
subject: Computer Networks
subtopic: Transport layer: flow control and congestion control, UDP, TCP, sockets

question_text: Consider a 5-stage pipelined processor with Instruction Fetch (IF), Instruction Decode (ID), Execute (EX), Memory Access (MEM), and Register Writeback (WB) stages. Which of the following statements about forwarding is/are CORRECT?
options: In a pipelined execution, forwarding means the result from a source stage of an earlier instruction is passed on to the destination stage of a later instruction
In forwarding, data from the output of the MEM stage can be passed on to the input of the EX stage of the next instruction
Forwarding cannot prevent all pipeline stalls
Forwarding does not require any extra hardware to retrieve the data from the pipeline stages
subject: Computer Organization and Architecture

question_text: Which of the following fields is/are modified in the IP header of a packet going out of a network address translation (NAT) device from an internal network to an external network?
subject: Computer Networks

question_text: Let A and B be non-empty finite sets such that there exist one-to-one and onto functions (i) from A to B and (ii) from A × A to A ∪ B. The number of possible values of |A| is _________.
subject: Engineering Mathematics
subtopic: Sets, relations, functions, partial orders and lattices

question_text:
Consider the operator precedence and associativity rules for the integer arithmetic operators given in the table below.
The value of the expression 3 + 1 + 5 * 2 / 7 + 2 – 4 – 7 – 6 / 2 as per the above rules is _________.
subject: Compiler Design

question_text: The number of spanning trees in a complete graph of 4 vertices labelled A, B, C, and D is _________.
subject: Engineering Mathematics

question_text:
Consider the following two relations, R(A,B) and S(A,C):
The total number of tuples obtained by evaluating the following expression σ_{B<C}(R ⋈_{R.A=S.A} S) is _________.
subject: Databases
subtopic: Relational model: relational algebra, tuple calculus, SQL

question_text:
Consider a network path P—Q—R between nodes P and R via router Q. Node P sends a file of size 10⁶ bytes to R via this path by splitting the file into chunks of 10³ bytes each. Node P sends these chunks one after the other without any wait time between the successive chunk transmissions. Assume that the size of extra headers added to these chunks is negligible, and that the chunk size is less than the MTU.
Each of the links P—Q and Q—R has a bandwidth of 10⁶ bits/sec, and negligible propagation latency. Router Q immediately transmits every packet it receives from P to R, with negligible processing and queueing delays. Router Q can simultaneously receive on link P—Q and transmit on link Q—R.
Assume P starts transmitting the chunks at time t = 0.
Which one of the following options gives the time (in seconds, rounded off to 3 decimal places) at which R receives all the chunks of the file?
subject: Computer Networks
subtopic: Basics of packet, circuit and virtual circuit-switching

question_text:
Consider the following syntax-directed definition (SDD).
Given "MMLK" as the input, which one of the following options is the CORRECT value computed by the SDD (in the attribute S.val)?
subject: Compiler Design

question_text:
Consider the following grammar G, with S as the start symbol. The grammar G has three incomplete productions denoted by (1), (2), and (3).
S → daT | (1)
T → aS | bT | (2)
R → (3) | ε
The set of terminals is {a, b, c, d, f}. The FIRST and FOLLOW sets of the different non-terminals are as follows.
FIRST(S) = {c, d, f}, FIRST(T) = {a, b, ε}, FIRST(R) = {c, ε}
FOLLOW(S) = FOLLOW(T) = {c, f, $}, FOLLOW(R) = {f}
Which one of the following options CORRECTLY fills in the incomplete productions?
options: (1) S → Rf (2) T → ε (3) R → cTR
(1) S → fR (2) T → ε (3) R → cTR
(1) S → fR (2) T → cT (3) R → cR
(1) S → Rf (2) T → cT (3) R → cR
subject: Compiler Design

question_text:
Consider the following pseudo-code.
L1: t1 = −1
L2: t2 = 0
L3: t3 = 0
L4: t4 = 4 ∗ t3
L5: t5 = 4 ∗ t2
L6: t6 = t5 ∗ M
L7: t7 = t4 + t6
L8: t8 = a[t7]
L9: if t8 <= max goto L11
L10: t1 = t8
L11: t3 = t3 + 1
L12: if t3 < M goto L4
L13: t2 = t2 + 1
L14: if t2 < N goto L3
L15: max = t1
Which one of the following options CORRECTLY specifies the number of basic blocks and the number of instructions in the largest basic block, respectively ?
subject: Compiler Design
Operating System
subtopic: System calls, processes, threads, inter-process communication, concurrency and synchronization

question_text: An array [82, 101, 90, 11, 111, 75, 33, 131, 44, 93] is heapified. Which one of the following options represents the first three elements in the heapified array?
subject: Programming and Data Structures
subtopic: Arrays, stacks, queues, linked lists, trees, binary search trees, binary heaps, graphs

subject: Engineering Mathematics
subtopic: Combinatorics: counting, recurrence relations, generating functions

question_text: Consider a binary min-heap containing 105 distinct elements. Let k be the index (in the underlying array) of the maximum element stored in the heap. The number of possible values of k is
subject: Programming and Data Structures
subtopic: Arrays, stacks, queues, linked lists, trees, binary search trees, binary heaps, graphs

question_text: The symbol → indicates functional dependency in the context of a relational database. Which of the following options is/are TRUE?
options: ((X, Y) → Z and W → Y) implies (X, W) → Z
(X → Y and Y → Z) implies X → Z
subject: Databases

question_text: Let G be a directed graph and T a depth first search (DFS) spanning tree in G that is rooted at a vertex v. Suppose T is also a breadth first search (BFS) tree in G, rooted at v. Which of the following statements is/are TRUE for every such graph G and tree T ?
options: There are no back-edges in G with respect to the tree T
There are no cross-edges in G with respect to the tree T
There are no forward-edges in G with respect to the tree T
The only edges in G are the edges in T
subject: Algorithms
subtopic: Graph traversals, minimum spanning trees, shortest paths

subject: Databases

question_text: Consider a Boolean expression given by F(X, Y, Z) = Σ(3,5,6,7). Which of the following statements is/are CORRECT?
options: F(X, Y, Z) = XY + YZ + XZ
F(X, Y, Z) is independent of input Y
F(X, Y, Z) is independent of input X
subject: Digital Logic

options: If the inputs are x=20, y=10, then the return value is greater than 2²⁰
If the inputs are x=20, y=20, then the return value is greater than 2²⁰
If the inputs are x=20, y=10, then the return value is less than 2¹⁰
If the inputs are x=10, y=20, then the return value is greater than 2²⁰
subject: Programming and Data Structures

question_text: Let A be any n × m matrix, where m > n. Which of the following statements is/are TRUE about the system of linear equations Ax = 0 ?
options: There exist at least m − n linearly independent solutions to this system
There exist m − n linearly independent vectors such that every solution is a linear combination of these vectors
There exists a non-zero solution in which at least m − n variables are 0
There exists a solution in which at least n variables are non-zero
subject: Engineering Mathematics

question_text:
Consider the 5-state DFA M accepting the language L(M) ⊂ (0+1)* shown below. For any string w ∈ (0+1)* let n₀(w) be the number of 0’s in w and n₁(w) be the number of 1’s in w.
Which of the following statements is/are FALSE?
options: States 2 and 4 are distinguishable in M
States 3 and 4 are distinguishable in M
States 2 and 5 are distinguishable in M
Any string w with n₀(w) = n₁(w) is in L(M)
subject: Theory of Computation

question_text: The chromatic number of a graph is the minimum number of colours used in a proper colouring of the graph. Let G be any graph with n vertices and chromatic number k. Which of the following statements is/are always TRUE?
options: G contains a complete subgraph with k vertices
G contains an independent set of size at least n/k
G contains at least k(k − 1)/2 edges
G contains a vertex of degree at least k
subject: Engineering Mathematics

question_text: Consider the operators ◊ and □ defined by a ◊ b = a + 2b, a □ b = ab, for positive integers. Which of the following statements is/are TRUE?
options: Operator ◊ over the operator □ obeys the distributive law
Operator □ over the operator ◊ obeys the distributive law
subject: Engineering Mathematics
subtopic: Sets, relations, functions, partial orders and lattices

question_text: Consider two set-associative cache memory architectures: WBC, which uses the write back policy, and WTC, which uses the write through policy. Both of them use the LRU (Least Recently Used) block replacement policy. The cache memory is connected to the main memory. Which of the following statements is/are TRUE?
options: A read miss in WBC never evicts a dirty block
A read miss in WTC never triggers a write back operation of a cache block to main memory
A write hit in WBC can modify the value of the dirty bit of a cache block
A write miss in WTC always writes the victim cache block to main memory before loading the missed block to the cache
subject: Computer Organization and Architecture
subtopic: Memory hierarchy: cache, main memory and secondary storage

question_text: Consider a 512 GB hard disk with 32 storage surfaces. There are 4096 sectors per track and each sector holds 1024 bytes of data. The number of cylinders in the hard disk is __________.
subject: Computer Organization and Architecture
subtopic: Memory hierarchy: cache, main memory and secondary storage

question_text:
The baseline execution time of a program on a 2 GHz single core machine is 100 nanoseconds (ns). The code corresponding to 90% of the execution time can be fully parallelized. The overhead for using an additional core is 10 ns when running on a multicore system. Assume that all cores in the multicore system run their share of the parallelized code for an equal amount of time.
The number of cores that minimize the execution time of the program is __________.
subject: Computer Organization and Architecture

question_text: A given program has 25% load/store instructions. Suppose the ideal CPI (cycles per instruction) without any memory stalls is 2. The program exhibits 2% miss rate on instruction cache and 8% miss rate on data cache. The miss penalty is 100 cycles. The speedup (rounded off to two decimal places) achieved with a perfect cache (i.e., with NO data or instruction cache misses) is __________.
subject: Computer Organization and Architecture
subtopic: Memory hierarchy: cache, main memory and secondary storage

subject: Operating System
subtopic: System calls, processes, threads, inter-process communication, concurrency and synchronization

question_text:
Consider the entries shown below in the forwarding table of an IP router. Each entry consists of an IP prefix and the corresponding next hop router for packets whose destination IP address matches the prefix. The notation “/N” in a prefix indicates a subnet mask with the most significant N bits set to 1.
This router forwards 20 packets each to 5 hosts. The IP addresses of the hosts are 10.1.1.16, 10.1.1.72, 10.1.1.132, 10.1.1.191, and 10.1.1.205 . The number of packets forwarded via the next hop router R2 is __________.
subject: Computer Networks
subtopic: Fragmentation and IP addressing, IPv4, CIDR notation

question_text: Let G = (V, Σ, S, P) be a context-free grammar in Chomsky Normal Form with Σ = {a, b, c} and V containing 10 variable symbols including the start symbol S. The string w = a³⁰b³⁰c³⁰ is derivable from S. The number of steps (application of rules) in the derivation S →* w is __________.
subject: Theory of Computation

question_text: The number of edges present in the forest generated by the DFS traversal of an undirected graph G with 100 vertices is 40. The number of connected components in G is __________.
subject: Algorithms
subtopic: Graph traversals, minimum spanning trees, shortest paths

question_text:
Consider the following two regular expressions over the alphabet {0,1}:
r = 0* + 1*
s = 01* + 10*
The total number of strings of length less than or equal to 5, which are neither in r nor in s, is __________.
subject: Theory of Computation

question_text: Consider a memory management system that uses a page size of 2 KB. Assume that both the physical and virtual addresses start from 0. Assume that the pages 0, 1, 2, and 3 are stored in the page frames 1, 3, 2, and 0, respectively. The physical address (in decimal format) corresponding to the virtual address 2500 (in decimal format) is __________.
subject: Operating System

question_text: A bag contains 10 red balls and 15 blue balls. Two balls are drawn randomly without replacement. Given that the first ball drawn is red, the probability (rounded off to 3 decimal places) that both balls drawn are red is __________.
subject: Engineering Mathematics

question_text:
Consider a digital logic circuit consisting of three 2-to-1 multiplexers M1, M2, and M3 as shown below. X1 and X2 are inputs of M1. X3 and X4 are inputs of M2. A, B, and C are select lines of M1, M2, and M3, respectively.
For an instance of inputs X1=1, X2=1, X3=0, and X4=0, the number of combinations of A, B, C that give the output Y=1 is __________.
subject: Digital Logic

question_text: Consider sending an IP datagram of size 1420 bytes (including 20 bytes of IP header) from a sender to a receiver over a path of two links with a router between them. The first link (sender to router) has an MTU (Maximum Transmission Unit) size of 542 bytes, while the second link (router to receiver) has an MTU size of 360 bytes. The number of fragments that would be delivered at the receiver is __________.
subject: Computer Networks
subtopic: Fragmentation and IP addressing, IPv4, CIDR notation
